page.title: 16THE GALA,HAMBLETON.
page.content: The Hambleton Gala was started in 1977 by Mrs.Holland headmistress at the school it was started to celebrate the Queen's Silver Jubilee.Until 1982 the gala was held in the school grounds. Then it was moved to St.Marys Approach.As well as the various stalls there is a show in the new village hall(Which was paid for by Hambleton Development Committee,who now organise the gala).There are quite a few classes to enter.For the last 3 years there has been a display of dancing by local schoolchildren.The week leading up to the gala is filled with a number of activities to attend,for example this year there was a film show,a wine and cheese evening,an organ recital and cream teas,a whist drive,a cabaret,a photographic exhibition,a trip to Bradford Ice Rink and a quiz night which our teachers won last year
